_header: Though feigned fables of old poetry
Note:
Critical edition, Fox (1981)
XFox, Denton. The Poems of Robert Henryson. Oxford: Clarendon, 1981, 3-110; see Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 70.
_description: Robert Henryson, Fables — a prologue and thirteen fables, mostly in rhyme royal

BLHar3865.First Lines:
Thocht feinȝeit fabillis of ald poetrieBe not all grunded vpon
                    truth ȝit than…
BLHar3865.Last Lines:
…Of saule and lyfe as thow art salmoneGrant ws to pas in till
                    ane blissit hour
BLHar3865.Attributed Title:
The morall fabillis of Esope compylit be maister Robert Henrisoun
                    Scolmaister of Dunfermling. 1571 (f. 1v)
BLHar3865.Editions:
Smith,  G. Gregory,
                        ed.  
             The Poems of Robert Henryson.
             3 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         55 (1906), 58 (1908), 64 (1914); rpt. New York, 1968: 3.3-315.

Banna.First Lines:
Thocht fenȝeit fables of auld poetreBe nocht grundit all vpoun
                    trewth ȝit than…
Banna.Last Lines:
…In glore quhair we may se þe sycht of godAnd thus endis
                    þe talking of þe tod
Banna.Note:
Ten fables of the usu. thirteen, in disarranged order in three
                    groupings.

EDU205.First Lines:
Thowcht fenȝeit fables of auld poetrybe nocht al groundit
                    vpone trewth ȝit þ[ ]…
EDU205.Last Lines:
…þar foir I [ ]d wil[ ] her sayga[ ] þar it
                    lay
EDU205.Note:
Prologue and First Fable only, with prose Moralitas at bottom of
                    f. iii; damage to leaf iii with loss of text.

Asloan.First Lines:
Isope myn auctor makis menciounOff twa mys and þai war
                    sisteres deir…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…Off erdly Ioy It beris mast degreBlythnes in hert with small
                    possessioun
Asloan.Note: Second Fable only; Nineteenth-century transcription by Gibbs is Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.III.450/1 [olim Laing 450], ff. 38-45v.
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Heir begynnes The tal of þe wplandis mous and þe borowstoun mous
                    (f. 236); heir endis of þe twa mys (f. 240)
